history.content: The GPA on CalCentral is in no way official, and it usually does not take care of exceptions (as in your case). Talk to your academic advisor and they would clarify your issue. If there is actually an exception, then don't worry; it will be taken care of on your transcript.
I've heard rumors that CalCentral has been struggling with this. Please open a ticket with Cal Student Central (online or in Sproul Hall). Your ticket should be routed to the Office of the Registrar.

I took Math 55 in the first semester of my sophomore year and got a decent grade in it. However, I took CS 70 this spring, because I wanted to minor in CS and ended up getting an F in the course, due to some family and mental health issues. My math counselor said that since I took Math 55 first, CS 70 wouldn't count towards my UC GPA and overall units. But when I did check my GPA, it seems to have counted!

Will I be put on academic probation for a course that is not supposed to count towards my GPA? And are there any restrictions on retaking a course for a CS minor?
history.subject: Math 55 and CS 70
